page.title: 04BIDEFORD BRIDGE
page.content: BEFORE THE{BRIDGE}WAS BUILT, THE ONLY WAY TO CROSS THE RIVER OTHER THAN BY BOAT, WAS A{FORD}WHICH CAME OUT ON THE WESTERN SIDE WHERE{FORD HOUSE}NOW STANDS. FROM THIS MAY HAVE COME THE TOWNS NAME. {BY-THE-FORD, BEDIFORDA, {BYDEFORD}AND OTHER SPELLINGS. THE BRIDGE HAS{24 ARCHES.}THERE IS A{LEGEND}ABOUT THE SIZE OF THE ARCHES. IT IS THAT 24 PEOPLE WERE ASKED FOR A SUM OF MONEY TO BUILD AN ARCH EACH. THE{LEGEND}SAYS THAT THE BIGGER ARCHES WERE BUILT WITH THE MONEY OF THE RICH, THE SMALLER ARCHES WITH THE MONEY OF THE POOR. THE MEDIUM ARCHES WERE SAID TO HAVE BEEN BUILT WITH THE MONEY OF NEITHER THE RICH OR THE POOR.
